titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Victor Hugo Collection
titlestmt.author: by Kathryn Rawdon

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:09
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Collection contains letters to and from Victor Hugo, as well as holographs of writings by Hugo. Correspondence includes letters to Hugo from Juliette Drouet, Aleksandr Herzen, comte Léopold Hugo, Jules Janin, Jean Toussaint Merle, and Jules Michelet. Letters from Hugo include letters to Laure Junot, duchesse d'Abrantès, A. de Beauchesne, Alexandre Dumas, and Almire Gandonnière. Writings contain holograph drafts of fragments of several works, including poems from Châtiments and Toute la lyre, fragments of chapters from L'Homme qui rit and Les Miserables, corrected proofs for several pages of Napoléon le petit, and a holograph of the play "Irtamène."

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ongoing collection of documents acquired by gift and purchase from various sources. Source information is recorded on the folders. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Victor Hugo Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Victor Hugo Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid is updated periodically to account for new materials that have been added to the collection. The date of the most recent update is noted on the title page. For information on material that may have been acquired for the collection since the last update, please consult the Public Service Desk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
This finding aid encompasses accessions of single manuscripts and small groups of manuscripts and other papers, by or pertaining to Victor Hugo, acquired by the library from a variety of sources. Materials incorporated into the collection prior to November 1998 have been organized into three series. Series I, Jean Gaudon Collection
, contains letters to Hugo and his wife, Adèle, from various individuals, as well as small holograph fragments of drafts of several of his works. Series II, Bronson Pinchot Collection
, contains letters from Hugo to various people, letters to Hugo from Juliette Drouet, and several holographs by Hugo, mostly untitled. Series III, Materials from Other Sources
, contains additional letters and writings by Hugo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Purchased from Jean Gaudon on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 1978

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regarding Hugo's failure to be elected to the Académie française

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On back of official form from the Dead Letter Office of Jersey to Hugo, dated 30 November 1852

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Fragments from "A l'obéissance passive" (II, 7), "Cette nuit-là" (I, 5), "Apothéose," "Joyeuse vie" (III, 1), "On est Tibère..." (V, 6), "Applaudissement" (VI, 16), "Force des Choses" (VII, 12), and notes from other works, possibly Théâtre en liberté

did.unittitle: L'Homme qui rit , holograph draft of part of one chapter (VII, 4)
Les Misérables , holograph draft of part of one chapter (V, 6, 2)
"Umbra," poem from Toute la Lyre (III, 45), holograph fragment
Unidentified holograph fragments related to Hugo's time in Jersey and his experience with spiritualism

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift of Bronson Pinchot (Yale Class of 1981), 1996; Purchased from Sotheby Co., 1994-1995, from the collection of Bronson Pinchot

Napoléon le Petit , corrected proofs of the first 16 pages
Untitled holograph about political figures from Henry VIII to Louis Napoleon
Untitled holograph poem on verso of drawing of a soldier in a café, entitled "Garde National de Paris" signed "Par Philipotteaux"
Empty paper wrapper entitled "Choses personelles - Notes pour des éclaircissements ou faits qui me concernant"
Envelope with holograph notes and shopping list
